Junk food fail: Just how unhealthy are New Zealand’s school tuck shops? https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/junk-food-fail-just-how-unhealthy-are-nzs-school-tuck-shops/CYFNHC4FJRGKZJMTQG374TDSC4/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/junk-food-fail-just-how-unhealthy-are-nzs-school-tuck-shops/CYFNHC4FJRGKZJMTQG374TDSC4/ Jamie MortonOur intermediate and secondary schools have received a fail grade for healthy menus. Sun, 17 Nov 2024 06:00:00 +0000 Junk foods like soft drinks, lollies and sausage rolls have been found to dominate healthier options in New Zealand’s school tuck shops, with just a tiny fraction of those surveyed meeting nutrition guidelines. Photo / Bay of Plenty Times

Police renew call for help finding missing man Graham Russell Smith https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/police-renew-call-for-help-finding-missing-man-graham-russell-smith/S7YZ6ZF75NHZ5JZWG6RHP7ZOC4/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/police-renew-call-for-help-finding-missing-man-graham-russell-smith/S7YZ6ZF75NHZ5JZWG6RHP7ZOC4/ Graham Russell Smith has been missing for a week. Sun, 17 Nov 2024 05:44:19 +0000 Police have released a new photo of missing Porirua man Graham Russell Smith who was reported missing on the evening of Sunday 10 November, after going for a walk on Doctor Track on the Rangituhi/Colonial Knob walkway. Photo / Supplied

‘Critical hazard blind spot’: Scientists probe Pacific volcanoes’ risk to New Zealand’s internet https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/ritic-hazard-blind-spot-scientists-probe-pacific-volcanoes-risk-to-nzs-internet/PGHHUBM3KBGF3KQFK62OB3KUUE/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/ritic-hazard-blind-spot-scientists-probe-pacific-volcanoes-risk-to-nzs-internet/PGHHUBM3KBGF3KQFK62OB3KUUE/ Jamie MortonScientists say huge undersea Pacific eruptions pose threat to cables linking NZ to world. Sun, 17 Nov 2024 04:00:00 +0000 When 2022′s spectacular Hunga Tonga-Hunga Ha’apai eruption cut a section of the 30,000km-long Southern Cross Cable, it took months and millions of dollars to fully restore Tonga’s internet connectivity.
